section_purpose: To describe the graph rewiring procedure used in experiments, which modifies graph connectivity based on curvature to demonstrate that flatter graphs are easier for GNN-based SAT solvers.
key_points: Graph rewiring modifies connectivity by adding, removing, or reweighting edges to optimize information flow.
Uses a discrete and stochastic Ricci flow guided by Balanced Forman Curvature (BFC) to increase average curvature.
Algorithm iteratively selects the edge with the most negative curvature and adds candidate edges to improve curvature.
Aims to reduce information bottlenecks, making the graph 'flatter' and easier for GNN-based solvers.
Alters SAT problem constraints but serves to show the relationship between curvature and solver performance.

formulas: Improvement score Î”_kl = -(Ric(i,j) - Ric'(i,j)), where Ric(i,j) is the BFC of edge (i,j) and Ric'(i,j) is the updated curvature after adding edge (k,l)

hyperparameters.p: probability value in [0,1] for random edge selection
